Oral acyclovir is modestly efficacious against orolabial herpes. In immunocompetent individuals, orolabial herpes is often self-limited, and antiviral treatment is generally not recommended.
7 However, oral acyclovir may be indicated for severe cases, for those with recurrent orolabial herpes, and in those who are immunocompromised.
